str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To go past, pass by, pass along by. From para and poreuomai; to travel near.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From blasphemos; to vilify; specially, to speak impiously.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To set in motion, move, remove, excite, stir up. From kio; to stir, literally or figuratively.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the primary kapto; the head, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Ah!, aha!, derisive. A primary exclamation of surprise; 'ah'.

word: You who are going to destroy
parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Vocative Masculine Singular
str2: From kata and luo; to loosen down, i.e. to demolish; specially to halt for the night.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A temple, a shrine, that part of the temple where God himself resides. From a primary naio; a fane, shrine, temple.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Vocative Masculine Singular
str2: From the same as oikodome; to be a house-builder, i.e. Construct or confirm.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Three. Or neuter tria a primary number; 'three'.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
